// Program for the ALMOSTPR problem
// Given an integer n, check if it has exactly 3 divisors
// 1 <= n <= 10**12

#include <cstdio>
#include <cstring>
#include <math.h>
#include <iostream>

using namespace std;

#define getcx getchar_unlocked

bool a[1000001];

// Fast IO function
inline void input(long long &n)
{
  n = 0;
  int ch = getcx(); int sign = 1;

  while(ch < '0' || ch > '9')
  {
    if(ch == '-')
     sign = -1; 
    ch = getcx();
  }
 
  while(ch >= '0' && ch <= '9')
  {
    n = (n << 3) + (n << 1) + ch - '0'; 
    ch = getcx();
  }

  n = n * sign;
}

// Primes - Sieve of Eratosthenes
void primes()
{
  memset(a, 1, sizeof(a));

  a[1] = a[0] = 0;
  for(int i = 2; i * i <= 1000000; i++)
   if(a[i])
    for(int k = i * i; k <= 1000000; k += i)
     a[k] = 0;
}

int main()
{
  int t, i;
  long long n, p;

  // Pre-calculation
  primes();

  scanf("%d", &t);
  while(t--)
  {
    input(n);
    p = sqrt(n);
 
    if(a[p] && p * p == n)
     printf("YES\n");
    else
     printf("NO\n");
  }

  return 0;
}
